page.title: 19BELLERBY_CHILDHOOD IN 1920
page.content: {RECOLLECTIONS OF OLDER RESIDENTS OF {BELLERBY Life seemed much harder than it is today.There were no cars,buses or telephones.Nearly everyone walked, except in an emergency,when a more "well off" resident might be asked to fetch the doctor in his pony and trap. School life was quite different too. We attended the village school till we were 14.There were no school dinners, the toilets were earth closets and we we were taught at long desks and benches.Lessons were very formal.At playtime we played with whips & tops, metal hoops,marbles and hop scotch.In P.E.lessons we did drill which involved marching and exercising with dumb bells. There were no school trips,no one ever came to talk to us and of course there was no radio or T.V.The only punishment was the cane.
